intro: Dissochaeta porphyrocarpa, commonly known as the purple-fruited Dichotomous, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its vibrant purple berries, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests.
